      trying to convince myself that it's not so hard to record a song

      that's only been in 1 video. it's an exclamation

2.28.22  12:44 am   in the music video for "i'm a princess", around the 2:05 mark, the stars on the chess board as well as the words "day", and this is the important part, "dream" are in distinct shades of green and blue. was this foreshadowing of the "more than a dream" music video and cover art?

     impossible. 'more than a dream' was not even written yet

     was the latter a reference to the former?

     no

     or a mere coincidence? 

      yes

2.28.22  12:32 am   how can I bridge the gap between wanting to do something and actually doing it?

      describe to someone else how they could do it

2.27.22  11:42 pm   Have you embraced the cold hard truth yet that in order to release videos faster then you can't make them as good as you want them to be

      since when have i ever been able to make them as good as i want them to be

2.27.22  11:23 pm   how do you come up with an original story, rather a narrative that has this world/reality in mind but in a sense of something different

      there's 2 ways: you can wait until the story comes to you, which sometimes it does, or, if you don't think you have time to wait for that, then you can use another trick which is to write down 10 story ideas and make half of them bad on purpose. by purposely making half of them bad, half of them will be good. sometimes the bad half is good

2.27.22  8:52 pm   how would you rate the sun and its services

      1 out of 1

      topography

      yes

      yes

      no

2.27.22  2:55 pm   what color is your next song going to be?

      it feels blue/green but the song itself will not be colored because it's audio. i don't know what color the cover image will be yet, and the contents of the video will have many colors. probably too many

2.27.22  11:47 am   What is love?

      it's the "yes" mode, of life

2.27.22  11:25 am   do you like typography?

      yes

      to push/pull the envelope

2.27.22  7:28 am   what was the thing you skipped in "maybe I could eat blades of grass"?

      the plot

2.27.22  4:38 am   i engineer songs. can i master your songs free of charge for the rest of my life?

      sure

2.27.22  1:26 am   do you like your songs

      i'm supposed to make them how i like. is this possible? well...... it's worth a try

2.27.22  12:50 am   I have a bunch of songs written but never seem to have the motivation to actually arrange and record them. what is your advice for my dilemma?

      try shorter songs first. there's possibly a million questions you'll have to answer for yourself, in the arranging and recording process. so it might be crucial to drastically reduce the product size at first, so it's easier to digest the situation

2.27.22  12:11 am   How many times does the word word appear in the next song video?

      1-ish

2.26.22  11:35 pm   Hey, I know this might a long shot but I'm wondering if you would be willing to answer a couple questions for a school English project I'm doing? I'm a big fan of your music and from reading your answers here and watching the reality videos, I feel like you might have some insightful things to say on this topic.

Essentially I'm writing an essay comparing digital music production to a "selfie": they are both ways of capturing a moment in time, who you were as well as the world around you, then sharing it with people around the world through the internet. I was wondering if you could share some of your own experience with this so that I could include it in my writing? I have a couple questions:

1. Could you explain how your experiences and personality at the time shaped the music you create, and how did your music change over time as you changed a person?

     as i get more experience, i can get better, but then that makes me get more attached to how good i think it's going, and then i get more afraid to take risks, so that creates a temporary problem. then i get desperate and snap and take more risks and it gets good again. this cycle repeats on all variations of timescales, long and short. even within 1 day

     2. Do you think self-expression through music has changed at all with the advent of online music sharing, compared to before the internet, and if so how?

     i was going to say yes but now that i think about it no

     3. In many ways, the music you create is an extension of yourself. Is it tough to put your music out there and be vulnerable in front of a wide audience which can now comment and give (potentially negative) feedback easily and quickly?

     the only thing more scary than doing it is not doing it

2.26.22  11:29 pm   What's the bpm of the next song?

      98

2.26.22  11:13 pm   when you wrote "i'm crazy/it's raining" were you actually depressed or did you just want to make a sad-sounding song?

     i was feeling a bit defeated

     also why did you look so happy when you played the triangle in that song

     why not

      sure

     yes

     it makes no difference to me. i don't notice the difference

      likely

      it's like a friendly scarf, that anyone can use

2.26.22  10:38 am   curious as to whether your lyrics have any actual meaning or do you just write things that rhyme and sound good

      i avoid things that rhyme too closely, but in terms of meaning you're the only one who can test that. if you listen to it and you find yourself uninterested, uninspired, and don't enjoy it, and want to turn it off, then the answer is no there's no meaning

      5.5

      yes

      insanely normal

      just do it manually. watched it and then drew a line of the path i saw
